title: Consumer Price Index of all urban consumers , by region 2019
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in each Country on the y axis.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is appeared to be the highest at Country West and lowest at Country Midwest.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) of Country West is 1.14% larger than the minimum value at Midwest.
min_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in each Country on the y axis.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is highest at Country West and lowest at Country Midwest.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in each Country on the y axis.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is appeared to be the highest at Country West and lowest at Country Midwest.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) of Country West is 1.14% larger than the minimum value at Midwest.
max_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in each Country on the y axis.
Country West has the highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) and Midwest has the lowest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984).
The second highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is appeared to be the Country Northeast.
The highest Country West has 32.57 more Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) than the lowest Country Midwest.
Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) at Country West is 270.35 , second place is Northeast at 269.39, and thirdly is U.S. city average at 255.66.
The Country West tends to be 1.06 percent higher than average.
